items.name: Object_Viewport
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Object_Viewport
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Object_Viewport extends gs.Object_Visual
    @objectCodecBlackList = ["parent"]
    
    ###*
    * A game object used for viewports.
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class Object_Viewport
    * @extends gs.Object_Visual
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: (viewport) ->
        super()
        
        if viewport
            @dstRect = new Rect(viewport.rect.x, viewport.rect.y, viewport.rect.width, viewport.rect.height)
        else
            @dstRect = new Rect(0, 0, Graphics.width, Graphics.height)
            
        ###*
        * The color tone of the object used for the visual presentation.
        * @property tone
        * @type gs.Tone
        ###
        @tone = new Tone(0, 0, 0, 0)
        
        ###*
        * The color of the object used for the visual presentation.
        * @property color
        * @type gs.Color
        ###
        @color = new Color(255, 255, 255, 0)
        
        ###*
        * The rotation-angle of the picture in degrees. The rotation center depends on the
        * anchor-point.
        * @property angle
        * @type number
        ###
        @angle = 0

        ###*
        * The object's animator-component to execute different kind of animations like move, rotate, etc. on it.
        * @property animator
        * @type vn.Component_Animator
        ###
        @animator = new gs.Component_Animator()
        
        ###*
        * The object's visual-component to display the game object on screen.
        * @property visual
        * @type gs.Component_Sprite
        ###
        @visual = new gs.Component_Viewport(viewport)
        
        @addComponent(@visual)
        @addComponent(@animator)
        
        #@update()
        
    ###*
    * Serializes the object into a data-bundle.
    *
    * @method toDataBundle
    * @return {Object} The data-bundle.
    ### 
    toDataBundle: ->
        components = @componentsToDataBundle(gs.Component_Animation)
                
        result = {
            dstRect: @dstRect,
            origin: @origin,
            zIndex: @zIndex,
            motionBlur: @motionBlur,
            zoom: @zoom,
            angle: @angle,
            anchor: @anchor,
            offset: @offset,
            tone: @tone,
            image: @image,
            components: components
        }
    
        return result
        
gs.Object_Viewport = Object_Viewport
